title: Reginaldo Haslett-Marroquin -- Decolonizing and Indigenizing Regenerative Agriculture (part 2 of 3)

tasks.task: Regenerate Chicken Farming According to Indigenous Methods
subtasks: Understand the holistic view of chickens' natural behaviors (hiding, shade-seeking, protection from predators)
Design farm layout to accommodate chicken needs (canopy, shelters, space), avoiding conflict with crops
Utilize regenerative land management practices (carbon sequestration, cover cropping, nutrient cycling)
Integrate multiple species (poultry, trees, plants) in agroforestry systems for mutual benefits
Manage feed as a part of the system cycle (sprouting, organic inputs, reduction in purchased feed)
Process and distribute poultry products through regionally-controlled supply chains, focusing on nutrition and community health
Collaborate with diverse communities and farmers to build collective wealth and resilience
Promote energy-efficient and spirit-connected farming practices by reversing colonization of mindsets
Implement land management practices that support long-term ecological health and cultural continuity

tasks.task: [MAINTASK: Transform agricultural landscapes into regenerative ecosystems via indigenous knowledge and collaboration]
